question.title: Object attribute always evaluates to not-null in a java streams map() transformation even though it is null in some cases
question.body:
So say, I have a class:

public class Clazz {
    final String someAttribute;

    public String getSomeAttribute() {
        return someAttribute;
    }
    
    public void setSomeAttribute(String someAttribute) {
        this.someAttribute = someAttribute;
    }
}

And I set the attribute on the class conditionally.

Clazz someObject = new Clasz();
if(someCondition) {
    someObject.setSomeAttribute(“someString”);
} else {

    //  someAttribute is not set, so it is null.
}

When I try to get the attribute via a map() transformation and use it in a ternary operation, I'm getting a compile-time warning saying that the object is never null, even though it can be.

Optional.ofNullable(someObject)
    .map(Clazz::getSomeAttribute)
    .map(someAttribute->Objects.notNull(someAttribute)) ? “string1” : string2)
    .orElse(“”);

Given that someAttribute is set conditionally, it is possible that it could be null, in which case Clazz::getSomeAttribute would return null. But, I’m getting a compile-time warning saying that Objects.notNull(someAttribute) is always false i.e. someAttribute is never null.

Does anyone have any insights as to why?

thanks in advance!
